In addition to successfully distinguishing between the different synoptic systems the dynamical systems indicators also underscore their salient physical characteristics. The PTs and RSTs are quasi-stationary systems (
22 ), which typically display high persistence. On the contrary, the CL and SL systems are moving disturbances (
23 ) and would hence be expected to have lower persistence. The Î¸ CDFs show the distinction between the two ( Fig. 1A). The high persistence of the PT and RST systems is accompanied by low values of d ( Fig. 1B), while the opposite is seen for the CL and SL cases.
